summary:
Anchorage is Alaska's biggest city, with nearly 300,000 people. It's located in south-central Alaska, between two arms of the Cook Inlet. The city started in 1915 when the Alaska Railroad was being built. It became an official city in 1920 and later merged with the Greater Anchorage Area Borough in 1975.

The municipality is huge, covering over 1,900 square miles, but only a small part is actually populated. The city is a major transportation hub, with a busy airport connecting it to many international destinations. Anchorage has won awards for being a great place to live, including being named the most tax-friendly city in the U.S.
title: Anchorage, Alaska
